{"step_by_step_thinking": "A cyst under the tongue caused by obstruction of a salivary gland is typically referred to as a Ranula. This is mentioned in Document [5] where it states that a mucocele occurs due to rupture of salivary gland duct or by blockade of salivary gland duct and the common site of occurrence of mucocele is lower lip followed by tongue, floor of mouth (ranula), and the buccal mucosa. Therefore, the correct answer is Ranula.", "answer_choice": "B"}
